text:
I tried 10 viral AI image generation prompts in both Nano Banana Pro and ChatGPT Images to see which one is better.

Here are the results:

Nano Banana Pro                       ChatGPT Images

1. Selfie
which ai is better than chatgpt ?

ChatGPT vs Gemini vs Claude: What Actually Sets Them Apart

If you spend your days juggling content, research, client work, and data the way many of us do, you already know this debate is getting louder. Three major AI tools, three very different personalities. After testing

ChatGPT Images vs Nano Banana Pro

Which is better? Which do you prefer?

Prompts + more examples ...

I made two models build the same app.

One is drastically better than the other, this will be my go to model now.

> Claude Opus 4.5 vs Gemini 3.0 Pro
> Exact same prompt
> Built using Rork AI

Guess which was Gemini and which was Opus (reveal in comments)

I ran the same prompts on ChatGPT 5.2 and Gemini 3.

The results shocked me.

ChatGPT felt like a senior engineer.
Precise. Logical. No fluff.

Gemini felt like a smart assistant.
Flexible. Practical. Plugged into real life.

Same task.
Very different brains.

Save this video,
Gemini now is far better than ChatGPT. This AI race is insane

Two Titans: ChatGPT 5.2 and Gemini 3 Pro

OpenAI and Google released their main models just a few weeks apart. Both claim to be the best – but in practice, each excels in its own area.

GPT-5.2 is better at writing code, solving math problems, and creating work documents. If

guys, which ai is better than chatgpt right now? i use gemini for images and GPT for text.

what are you using right now?

chatGPT has a much better app than Gemini. Feels more coherent.

Gemini is smart, but constrained with an army of idiots from google who gave it a shitty interface, dumb restrictions, and god damn bugs that ruin chats.

Which AI assistant do you think is better overall, easy to use, and brings the best results?

1.  ChatGPT (by OpenAI)
2.  Grok (by xAI / Elon Musk)
3.  Gemini (by Google DeepMind)
4.  Claude (by Anthropic)

Prove with your experience
